item.description:
Here is the advertisement:

http://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Anarchist-Society-of-Shakespeareans/195235037166260#!/photo.php?fbid=297708376918925&set=a.195240527165711.44593.195235037166260&type=1&theater

This is a play very well choreographed (with 1 flaw). We attended it last weekend. It is worth going to AGAIN!!

We love Shakespeare. Measure for Measure is one of his plays that is a little hard to interpret because there are different versions of it; so you should review it before attending.

The play begins at 8. I heartily recommend you get there to grab your seat by 7:30 latest.

There will still be a quality intellectual challenge to be had. About the one flaw: I will warn you in advance when we meet. If I don't get to tell you, ask me about it.

LETS MEET AT DAEDALUS FOR A BEER BEFORE THIS MEETUP. IT'S RIGHT NEXT DOOR. LOOK FOR PEOPLE WITH HATS AT THE BAR --PLEASE WEAR HATS.

IF YOU SKIP DAEDALUS, MEET US DIRECTLY AT THE DEMOCRACY CENTER FOR THE PLAY, 45 MOUNT AUBURN ST. THEY ARE ASKING FOR A 5 $ DONATION THERE.

This is classic Shakespeare-- there is a minimalist stage --in the middle! yes there are costumes. This is three hours long, including a half hour intermission with refreshments provided.

VERY IMPORTANT-- LIMITED SEATING

BE SURE & GET TO THE PLAY EARLY TO GRAB YOUR SEAT--FIRST COME FIRST SERVE.

http://www.daedalusharvardsquare.com/
item.name: Measure for Measure-- "Shakespearean" version
